data.enText: the killing of a large number of people especially in a cruel way

data.chText: 对无辜平民的血腥屠杀
data.enText: the bloody massacre of innocent civilians
a very big defeat in a game or competition

data.chText: 这场比赛我们队以0：10惨败。
data.enText: The game was a 10–0 massacre for our team.
to kill a large number of people, especially in a cruel way
to defeat sb in a game or competition by a high score

tr: the savage and excessive killing of many people
kill a large number of people indiscriminately
example: The Hutus massacred the Tutsis in Rwanda

value.def: A massacre is the killing of a large number of people at the same time in a violent and cruel way.

example.ex: Maria lost her 62-year-old mother in the massacre.
example.tran: 在大屠杀中玛丽亚失去了62岁的母亲。
关于屠杀、拷打与挨饿的报道

value.def: If people are massacred, a large number of them are attacked and killed in a violent and cruel way.

example.ex: 300 civilians are believed to have been massacred by the rebels...
example.tran: 据信有300位平民被叛乱分子残杀。

example.ex: Troops indiscriminately massacred the defenceless population.
example.tran: 军队肆无忌惮地屠杀手无寸铁的民众。

value.tran: 大规模屠杀;大规模残杀
